name: Caterpie
flavorText: For protection, it releases a horrible stench from the antenna on its head to drive away enemies.
Ability1Text: This Pokemon can evolve during your first turn or the turn you play it.

name: Metapod
flavorText: It is waiting for the moment to evolve. At this stage, it can only harden, so it remains motionless to avoid attack.
Ability1Text: This Pokemon can evolve during your first turn or the turn you play it.

name: Butterfree
flavorText: In battle, it flaps its wings at great speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Burned, Confused, and Poisoned.

name: Scyther
flavorText: Its two sharp scythes are more than just weapons. It uses them with dexterity to dress its prey before eating.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, this Pokemon's Blinding Scythe attack does 70 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Shuckle
flavorText: It stores berries inside its shell. To avoid attacks, it hides beneath rocks and remains completely still.
Attack1Text: Shuffle up to 5 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Heracross
flavorText: It roams through forests searching for sweet nectar. Although it boasts fantastic physical strength, it's not that good at flying.
Attack1Text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokemon with 1 of their Benched Pokemon.

name: Lotad
flavorText: It searches about for clean water. If it does not drink water for too long, the leaf on its head wilts.
Attack1Text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokemon.

name: Lombre
flavorText: It is nocturnal and becomes active at nightfall. It feeds on aquatic mosses that grow in the riverbed.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, if you drew this Pokemon from your deck at the beginning of your turn and your Bench isn't full, before you put it into your hand, you may put it onto your Bench.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

name: Ludicolo
flavorText: The rhythm of bright, festive music activates Ludicolo's cells, making it more powerful.
Attack1Text: This attack does 60 damage for each Prize card you have taken.
Attack2Text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokemon.

name: Surskit
flavorText: It lives in ponds and marshes that feature lots of plant life. It often fights with Dewpider, whose habitat and diet are similar.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokemon.

name: Masquerain
flavorText: Its thin, winglike antennae are highly absorbent. It waits out rainy days in tree hollows.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, Energy can't be attached from your opponent's hand to the Defending Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Switch this Pokemon with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Snover
flavorText: It lives on snowy mountains. It sinks its legs into the snow to absorb water and keep its own temperature down.

name: Abomasnow
flavorText: If it sees any packs of Darumaka going after Snover, it chases them off, swinging its sizable arms like hammers.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Phantump
flavorText: After a lost child perished in the forest, their spirit possessed a tree stump, causing the spirit's rebirth as this Pokemon.
Attack1Text: Put a Basic Pokemon from your discard pile onto your Bench.

name: Trevenant
flavorText: People fear it due to a belief that it devours any who try to cut down trees in its forest, but to the Pokemon it shares its woods with, it's kind.
Attack2Text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokemon can't retreat.

name: Grubbin
flavorText: Its natural enemies, like Rookidee, may flee rather than risk getting caught in its large mandibles that can snap thick tree branches.

name: Rillaboom V
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Grass Pokemon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: This Pokemon also does 30 damage to itself.

name: Rillaboom VMAX
Attack2Text: You may discard up to 3 Grass Energy from this Pokemon. If you do, this attack does 50 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

name: Eldegoss V
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokemon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may put a Supporter card from your discard pile into your hand.
Attack1Text: You may shuffle this Pokemon and all attached cards into your deck.

name: Applin
flavorText: It spends its entire life inside an apple. It hides from its natural enemies, bird Pokemon, by pretending it's just an apple and nothing more.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

name: Applin
flavorText: It spends its entire life inside an apple. It hides from its natural enemies, bird Pokemon, by pretending it's just an apple and nothing more.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokemon by attacks.

name: Flapple
flavorText: It ate a sour apple, and that induced its evolution. In its cheeks, it stores an acid capable of causing chemical burns.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, you may put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. If you placed any damage counters in this way, shuffle this Pokemon and all attached cards into your deck.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokemon.

name: Appletun
flavorText: Eating a sweet apple caused its evolution. A nectarous scent wafts from its body, luring in the bug Pokemon it preys on.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, you may flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Basic Pokemon with their Active Pokemon.

name: Vulpix
flavorText: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Ninetales
flavorText: It is said to live 1,000 years, and each of its tails is loaded with supernatural powers.
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 90 more damage.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Ninetales V
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokemon's attacks and use it as this attack.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy from this Pokemon.

name: Growlithe
flavorText: It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, put a card from your discard pile into your hand.

name: Arcanine
flavorText: The sight of it running over 6,200 miles in a single day and night has captivated many people.
Ability1Text: If this Pokemon has a Burning Scarf attached, it gets +100 HP.

name: Magmar
flavorText: Its entire body is burning. When it breathes, the temperature rises. When it sneezes, flames shoot out!
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

name: Magmortar
flavorText: Magmortar takes down its enemies by shooting fireballs, which burn them to a blackened crisp. It avoids this method when hunting prey.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Burned.
Attack2Text: Each player discards the top card of their deck. This attack does 100 more damage for each Energy card discarded in this way.

name: Litwick
flavorText: The flame on its head keeps its body slightly warm. This Pokemon takes lost children by the hand to guide them to the spirit world.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Burned.

name: Lampent
flavorText: This Pokemon appears just before someone passes away, so it's feared as an emissary of death.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, if you drew this Pokemon from your deck at the beginning of your turn and your Bench isn't full, before you put it into your hand, you may put it onto your Bench.
Attack1Text: Attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokemon.

name: Chandelure
flavorText: This Pokemon haunts dilapidated mansions. It sways its arms to hypnotize opponents with the ominous dancing of its flames.
Ability1Text: All of your Pokemon that have Energy attached have no Weakness.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Heatmor
flavorText: There's a hole in its tail that allows it to draw in the air it needs to keep its fire burning. If the hole gets blocked, this Pokemon will fall ill.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy from this Pokemon.

name: Cinderace V
Ability1Text: If a Stadium is in play, this Pokemon has no Retreat Cost.

name: Cinderace VMAX
Attack1Text: If this Pokemon was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does that much more damage.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Burned.

name: Galarian Mr. Mime
flavorText: Its talent is tap-dancing. It can also manipulate temperatures to create a floor of ice, which this Pokemon can kick up to use as a barrier.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

name: Galarian Mr. Rime
flavorText: It's highly skilled at tap-dancing. It waves its cane of ice in time with its graceful movements.
Ability1Text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to all of your Pokemon that have Energy attached. (Existing effects are not removed.)
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

name: Magikarp
flavorText: It is virtually worthless in terms of both power and speed. It is the most weak and pathetic Pokemon in the world.
Attack1Text: Switch this Pokemon with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Gyarados
flavorText: It has an extremely aggressive nature. The Hyper Beam it shoots from its mouth totally incinerates all targets.
Attack2Text: Discard any Stadium in play.

name: Wingull
flavorText: It makes its nest on sheer cliffs. Riding the sea breeze, it glides up into the expansive skies.
Attack1Text: Draw a card.

name: Pelipper
flavorText: It is a messenger of the skies, carrying small Pokemon and eggs to safety in its bill.
Attack2Text: Move an Energy from this Pokemon to 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Milotic V
Attack1Text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokemon's Retreat Cost.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Tympole
flavorText: Graceful ripples running across the water's surface are a sure sign that Tympole are singing in high-pitched voices below.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Palpitoad
flavorText: It weakens its prey with sound waves intense enough to cause headaches, then entangles them with its sticky tongue.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Seismitoad
flavorText: The vibrating of the bumps all over its body causes earthquake-like tremors. Seismitoad and Croagunk are similar species.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is Confused, this attack does 120 more damage.

name: Galarian Darumaka
flavorText: It lived in snowy areas for so long that its fire sac cooled off and atrophied. It now has an organ that generates cold instead.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Galarian Darmanitan
flavorText: On days when blizzards blow through, it comes down to where people live. It stashes food in the snowball on its head, taking it home for later.
Attack1Text: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: During your next turn, this Pokemon can't use Crushing Headbutt.

name: Inteleon V
Attack1Text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: Your opponent reveals their hand.

name: Inteleon VMAX
Attack1Text: You may put an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokemon into their hand.
Attack2Text: This attack also does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Cramorant
flavorText: It's so strong that it can knock out some opponents in a single hit, but it also may forget what it's battling midfight.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokemon.
Attack2Text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokemon.

name: Arrokuda
flavorText: If it sees any movement around it, this Pokemon charges for it straightaway, leading with its sharply pointed jaw. It's very proud of that jaw.

name: Barraskewda
flavorText: This Pokemon has a jaw that's as sharp as a spear and as strong as steel. Apparently Barraskewda's flesh is surprisingly tasty, too.
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Water Energy cards from your hand. If you don't, this attack does nothing.

name: Eiscue
flavorText: It drifted in on the flow of ocean waters from a frigid place. It keeps its head iced constantly to make sure it stays nice and cold.
Ability1Text: If this Pokemon has full HP, it takes 60 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Eiscue V
Ability1Text: Whenever you attach a Water Energy card from your hand to this Pokemon during your turn, heal 30 damage from it.
Attack1Text: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Voltorb
flavorText: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poke Ball, it has zapped many people.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

name: Electrode
flavorText: It stores an overflowing amount of electric energy inside its body. Even a small shock makes it explode.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 3 Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Electabuzz
flavorText: While it's often blamed for power outages, the truth is the cause of outages is more often an error on the part of the electric company.

name: Electivire
flavorText: A single Electivire can provide enough electricity for all the buildings in a big city for a year.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: If this Pokemon has any Special Energy attached, this attack does 90 more damage.

name: Shinx
flavorText: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.
Attack1Text: If your opponent has 3 or fewer Prize cards remaining, this attack does 50 more damage.

name: Luxio
flavorText: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, if you drew this Pokemon from your deck at the beginning of your turn and your Bench isn't full, before you put it into your hand, you may put it onto your Bench.

name: Luxray
flavorText: Luxray's ability to see through objects comes in handy when it's scouting for danger.
Attack1Text: If this Pokemon evolved from Luxio during this turn, this attack does 100 more damage.

name: Helioptile
flavorText: When spread, the frills on its head act like solar panels, generating the power behind this Pokemon's electric moves.
Attack1Text: This Pokemon also does 10 damage to itself.

name: Heliolisk
flavorText: A now-vanished desert culture treasured these Pokemon. Appropriately, when Heliolisk came to the Galar region, treasure came with them.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokemon.
Attack2Text: This Pokemon also does 30 damage to itself.

name: Charjabug
flavorText: While its durable shell protects it from attacks, Charjabug strikes at enemies with jolts of electricity discharged from the tips of its jaws.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Lightning Energy cards and attach them to this Pokemon. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Vikavolt
flavorText: It builds up electricity in its abdomen, focuses it through its jaws, and then fires the electricity off in concentrated beams.
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Energy attached to all of your Pokemon.
Attack2Text: This Pokemon also does 30 damage to itself.

name: Boltund V
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Lightning Energy cards and attach them to your Benched Pokemon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Lightning Energy attached to all of your Pokemon.

name: Toxel
flavorText: It stores poison in an internal poison sac and secretes that poison through its skin. If you touch this Pokemon, a tingling sensation follows.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Toxtricity
flavorText: When this Pokemon sounds as if it's strumming a guitar, it's actually clawing at the protrusions on its chest to generate electricity.
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Toxtricity V
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is Poisoned, this attack does 90 more damage.

name: Toxtricity VMAX
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is Poisoned, this attack does 80 more damage.

name: Pincurchin V
Ability1Text: If this Pokemon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if it is Knocked Out), flip 3 coins. For each heads, put 3 damage counters on the Attacking Pokemon.

name: Morpeko
flavorText: As it eats the seeds stored up in its pocket-like pouches, this Pokemon is not just satisfying its constant hunger. It's also generating electricity.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokemon's attacks. During your opponent's next turn, that Pokemon can't use that attack.
Attack2Text: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Clefairy
flavorText: It is said that happiness will come to those who see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a full moon.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Clefable
flavorText: A timid fairy Pokemon that is rarely seen, it will run and hide the moment it senses people.
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokemon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokemon during your turn, you may put an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokemon on top of their deck.

name: Natu
flavorText: It is extremely good at climbing tree trunks and likes to eat the new sprouts on the trees.
Attack1Text: Draw a card.

name: Xatu
flavorText: They say that it stays still and quiet because it is seeing both the past and future at the same time.
Attack1Text: Move an Energy from 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon to their Active Pokemon.
Attack2Text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokemon.

name: Galarian Corsola
flavorText: Watch your step when wandering areas oceans once covered. What looks like a stone could be this Pokemon, and it will curse you if you kick it.
Attack1Text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Pokemon in any way you like.

name: Galarian Cursola
flavorText: Its shell is overflowing with its heightened otherworldly energy. The ectoplasm serves as protection for this Pokemon's core spirit.
Ability1Text: If this Pokemon is in the Active Spot and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, flip a coin. If heads, the Attacking Pokemon is Knocked Out.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokemon can't retreat.

name: Sigilyph
flavorText: Psychic power allows these Pokemon to fly. Some say they were the guardians of an ancient city. Others say they were the guardians' emissaries.
Ability1Text: If this Pokemon is your Active Pokemon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokemon is Knocked Out), put 3 damage counters on the Attacking Pokemon.
Attack1Text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokemon.

name: Sandygast
flavorText: If you build sand mounds when you're playing, destroy them before you go home, or they may get possessed and become Sandygast.
Attack1Text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokemon.

name: Palossand
flavorText: Once it has whipped up a sandstorm to halt its opponents in their tracks, this terrifying Pokemon snatches away their vitality.
Attack1Text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck. If this Pokemon has a Cursed Shovel attached, discard 2 more cards from the top of your opponent's deck.
Attack2Text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokemon.

name: Hatenna
flavorText: Via the protrusion on its head, it senses other creatures' emotions. If you don't have a calm disposition, it will never warm up to you.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Pokemon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Hattrem
flavorText: No matter who you are, if you bring strong emotions near this Pokemon, it will silence you violently.
Attack1Text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

name: Hatterene
flavorText: It emits psychic power strong enough to cause headaches as a deterrent to the approach of others.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, you may use this Ability. Each player discards a card from their hand. (Your opponent discards first.)
Attack1Text: Put 1 damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokemon for each Pokemon in your discard pile.

name: Milcery
flavorText: This Pokemon was born from sweet-smelling particles in the air. Its body is made of cream.
Attack1Text: Heal 10 damage from each of your Pokemon.

name: Alcremie
flavorText: When it trusts a Trainer, it will treat them to berries it's decorated with cream.
Attack1Text: Attach any number of basic Energy cards from your hand to your Pokemon in any way you like.
Attack2Text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokemon.

name: Indeedee
flavorText: These intelligent Pokemon touch horns with each other to share information between them.
Attack1Text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Dreepy
flavorText: After being reborn as a ghost Pokemon, Dreepy wanders the areas it used to inhabit back when it was alive in prehistoric seas.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

name: Drakloak
flavorText: It's capable of flying faster than 120 mph. It battles alongside Dreepy and dotes on them until they successfully evolve.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Dreepy and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Dragapult
flavorText: When it isn't battling, it keeps Dreepy in the holes on its horns. Once a fight starts, it launches the Dreepy like supersonic missiles.
Ability1Text: If any damage is done to this Pokemon by attacks, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.
Attack1Text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Benched Pokemon in any way you like.

name: Dragapult V
Attack2Text: If this Pokemon moved from your Bench to the Active Spot this turn, this attack does 80 more damage.

name: Dragapult VMAX
Attack1Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Put 5 damage counters on your opponent's Benched Pokemon in any way you like.

name: Galarian Farfetch'd
flavorText: The Farfetch'd of the Galar region are brave warriors, and they wield thick, tough leeks in battle.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

name: Galarian Sirfetch'd
flavorText: Only Farfetch'd that have survived many battles can attain this evolution. When this Pokemon's leek withers, it will retire from combat.
Attack2Text: This Pokemon can't use Meteor Assault again until it leaves the Active Spot.

name: Nosepass
flavorText: It hunts without twitching a muscle by pulling in its prey with powerful magnetism. But sometimes it pulls natural enemies in close.

name: Meditite
flavorText: It eats just one berry a day. By enduring hunger, its spirit is tempered and made sharper.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Medicham
flavorText: Through yoga training, it gained the psychic power to predict its foe's next move.
Attack1Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.
Attack2Text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokemon.

name: Barboach
flavorText: Its slimy body is hard to grasp. In one region, it is said to have been born from hardened mud.

name: Whiscash
flavorText: It makes its nest at the bottom of swamps. It will eat anything—if it is alive, Whiscash will eat it.
Ability1Text: As long as this Pokemon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokemon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).
Attack1Text: This attack also does 20 damage to each of your Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Galarian Yamask
flavorText: A clay slab with cursed engravings took possession of a Yamask. The slab is said to be absorbing the Yamask's dark power.
Attack1Text: This Pokemon also does 30 damage to itself.

name: Galarian Runerigus
flavorText: A powerful curse was woven into an ancient painting. After absorbing the spirit of a Yamask, the painting began to move.
Attack1Text: For each damage counter on this Galarian Runerigus, put 2 damage counters on your opponent's Pokemon in any way you like.
Attack2Text: This Pokemon also does 30 damage to itself.

name: Binacle
flavorText: After two Binacle find a suitably sized rock, they adhere themselves to it and live together. They cooperate to gather food during high tide.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

name: Barbaracle
flavorText: Seven Binacle come together to form one Barbaracle. The Binacle that serves as the head gives orders to those serving as the limbs.
Attack1Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.
Attack2Text: If you have more cards in your hand than your opponent, this attack does 80 more damage.

name: Rolycoly
flavorText: Most of its body has the same composition as coal. Fittingly, this Pokemon was first discovered in coal mines about 400 years ago.

name: Carkol
flavorText: It forms coal inside its body. Coal dropped by this Pokemon once helped fuel the lives of people in the Galar region.

name: Coalossal
flavorText: It's usually peaceful, but the vandalism of mines enrages it. Offenders will be incinerated with flames that reach 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Fire Energy card, a Fighting Energy card, or 1 of each from your discard pile to your Pokemon in any way you like.

name: Sandaconda V
Attack1Text: Attach a Fighting Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokemon.

name: Falinks
flavorText: Five of them are troopers, and one is the brass. The brass's orders are absolute.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokemon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: This attack does 30 damage for each of your Benched Pokemon that has "Falinks" in its name.

name: Falinks V
Ability1Text: All of your Pokemon that have "Falinks" in their name take 20 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: During your next turn, this Pokemon can't attack.

name: Stonjourner
flavorText: It stands in grasslands, watching the sun's descent from zenith to horizon. This Pokemon has a talent for delivering dynamic kicks.
Attack2Text: If this Pokemon has at least 1 extra Energy attached (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 60 more damage.

name: Koffing
flavorText: Its body is full of poisonous gas. It floats into garbage dumps, seeking out the fumes of raw, rotting trash.

name: Galarian Weezing
flavorText: This Pokemon consumes particles that contaminate the air. Instead of leaving droppings, it expels clean air.
Ability1Text: As long as this Pokemon is in the Active Spot, your opponent's Pokemon in play have no Abilities, except for Neutralizing Gas.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Poisoned. Put 4 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokemon during Pokemon Checkup.

name: Stunky
flavorText: From its rear, it sprays a foul-smelling liquid at opponents. It aims for their faces, and it can hit them from over 16 feet away.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Skuntank
flavorText: In its belly, it reserves stinky fluid that it shoots from its tail during battle. As this Pokemon's diet varies, so does the stench of its fluid.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Poisoned. During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokemon can't retreat.

name: Spiritomb
flavorText: It was bound to a fissure in an Odd Keystone as punishment for misdeeds 500 years ago.
Attack1Text: Discard the top card of each player's deck.
Attack2Text: Put 1 damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokemon for each Pokemon in your discard pile.

name: Trubbish
flavorText: Its favorite places are unsanitary ones. If you leave trash lying around, you could even find one of these Pokemon living in your room.
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is Poisoned, this attack does 50 more damage.

name: Garbodor
flavorText: This Pokemon eats trash, which turns into poison inside its body. The main component of the poison depends on what sort of trash was eaten.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, if a Stadium is in play, you may make your opponent's Active Pokemon Poisoned.

name: Vullaby
flavorText: It wears a bone to protect its rear. It often squabbles with others of its kind over particularly comfy bones.
Attack1Text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokemon Tools from your opponent's Active Pokemon.

name: Mandibuzz
flavorText: Although it's a bit of a ruffian, this Pokemon will take lost Vullaby under its wing and care for them till they're ready to leave the nest.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.
Attack2Text: This attack does 100 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Malamar V
Attack1Text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon with their Active Pokemon. This attack does 30 damage to the new Active Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Malamar VMAX
Attack1Text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Choose a card you find there and put it on the bottom of their deck.

name: Impidimp
flavorText: Through its nose, it sucks in the emanations produced by people and Pokemon when they feel annoyed. It thrives off this negative energy.

name: Morgrem
flavorText: When it gets down on all fours as if to beg for forgiveness, it's trying to lure opponents in so that it can stab them with its spear-like hair.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokemon.

name: Grimmsnarl
flavorText: With the hair wrapped around its body helping to enhance its muscles, this Pokemon can overwhelm even Machamp.
Ability1Text: As long as this Pokemon is in the Active Spot, your opponent's Active Pokemon's attacks cost Colorless more.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokemon.

name: Galarian Meowth
flavorText: Living with a savage, seafaring people has toughened this Pokemon's body so much that parts of it have turned to iron.
Ability1Text: You must discard 2 cards from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may search your deck for a Galarian Perrserker, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Galarian Perrserker
flavorText: What appears to be an iron helmet is actually hardened hair. This Pokemon lives for the thrill of battle.
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

name: Scizor
flavorText: Once it has identified something as an enemy, it will continue beating them with its steel-hard pincers until there's nothing left but scraps.
Attack1Text: If this Pokemon evolved from Scyther during this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.
Attack2Text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokemon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Bronzor
flavorText: It appears in ancient ruins. The pattern on its body doesn't come from any culture in the Galar region, so it remains shrouded in mystery.

name: Bronzong
flavorText: Some believe it to be a deity that summons rain clouds. When angered, it lets out a warning cry that rings out like the tolling of a bell.
Attack2Text: Switch this Pokemon with 1 of your Benched Pokemon. If you do, your opponent switches their Active Pokemon with 1 of their Benched Pokemon.

name: Probopass
flavorText: It uses three small units to catch prey and battle enemies. The main body mostly just gives orders.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokemon's Retreat Cost.

name: Durant
flavorText: They lay their eggs deep inside their nests. When attacked by Heatmor, they retaliate using their massive mandibles.
Attack1Text: For each Energy attached to this Pokemon, search your deck for a Trainer card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Honedge
flavorText: Honedge's soul once belonged to a person who was killed a long time ago by the sword that makes up Honedge's body.

name: Doublade
flavorText: Honedge evolves into twins. The two blades rub together to emit a metallic sound that unnerves opponents.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

name: Aegislash
flavorText: In this defensive stance, Aegislash uses its steel body and a force field of spectral power to reduce the damage of any attack.
Ability1Text: All of your Pokemon take 30 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't apply more than 1 Big Shield Ability at a time.

name: Copperajah V
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokemon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Copperajah VMAX
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is a Basic Pokemon, this attack does 100 more damage.

name: Duraludon
flavorText: Its body resembles polished metal, and it's both lightweight and strong. The only drawback is that it rusts easily.
Attack1Text: Attach a Metal Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokemon.

name: Zacian
flavorText: Now armed with a weapon it used in ancient times, this Pokemon needs only a single strike to fell even Gigantamax Pokemon.
Attack1Text: Attach a Metal Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard 2 Energy from this Pokemon.

name: Zamazenta
flavorText: Its ability to deflect any attack led to it being known as the Fighting Master's Shield. It was feared and respected by all.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokemon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokemon can't attack during your next turn.

name: Snorlax
flavorText: It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds of food every day. When it is done eating, it goes promptly to sleep.
Attack1Text: Draw 2 cards.
Attack2Text: This Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Chatot
flavorText: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokemon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may flip a coin. If heads, put a Supporter card from your discard pile into your hand.

name: Pidove
flavorText: Where people go, these Pokemon follow. If you're scattering food for them, be careful—several hundred of them can gather at once.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokemon with Fighting Resistance, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Tranquill
flavorText: It can fly moderately quickly. No matter how far it travels, it can always find its way back to its master and its nest.

name: Unfezant
flavorText: Unfezant are exceptional fliers. The females are known for their stamina, while the males outclass them in terms of speed.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokemon's attacks do 50 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy from this Pokemon.

name: Bunnelby
flavorText: It excels at digging holes. Using its ears, it can dig a nest 33 feet deep in one night.
Attack1Text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

name: Diggersby
flavorText: With power equal to an excavator, it can dig through dense bedrock. It's a huge help during tunnel construction.
Attack1Text: Discard up to 6 cards from the top of your deck. If you do, this attack does 30 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

name: Hawlucha
flavorText: It drives its opponents to exhaustion with its agile maneuvers, then ends the fight with a flashy finishing move.
Attack1Text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 5 cards.

name: Stufful
flavorText: Its fluffy fur is a delight to pet, but carelessly reaching out to touch this Pokemon could result in painful retaliation.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

name: Bewear
flavorText: Once it accepts you as a friend, it tries to show its affection with a hug. Letting it do that is dangerous—it could easily shatter your bones.
Attack1Text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard your opponent's Active Pokemon and all attached cards.

name: Skwovet
flavorText: Found throughout the Galar region, this Pokemon becomes uneasy if its cheeks are ever completely empty of berries.

name: Greedent
flavorText: It stashes berries in its tail—so many berries that they fall out constantly. But this Pokemon is a bit slow-witted, so it doesn't notice the loss.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for a Pokemon Tool card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Dubwool V
Ability1Text: This Pokemon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

name: Rillaboom V
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Grass Pokemon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: This Pokemon also does 30 damage to itself.

name: Eldegoss V
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokemon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may put a Supporter card from your discard pile into your hand.
Attack1Text: You may shuffle this Pokemon and all attached cards into your deck.

name: Ninetales V
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokemon's attacks and use it as this attack.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy from this Pokemon.

name: Cinderace V
Ability1Text: If a Stadium is in play, this Pokemon has no Retreat Cost.

name: Milotic V
Attack1Text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokemon's Retreat Cost.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Inteleon V
Attack1Text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: Your opponent reveals their hand.

name: Boltund V
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Lightning Energy cards and attach them to your Benched Pokemon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Lightning Energy attached to all of your Pokemon.

name: Toxtricity V
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is Poisoned, this attack does 90 more damage.

name: Dragapult V
Attack2Text: If this Pokemon moved from your Bench to the Active Spot this turn, this attack does 80 more damage.

name: Sandaconda V
Attack1Text: Attach a Fighting Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokemon.

name: Falinks V
Ability1Text: All of your Pokemon that have "Falinks" in their name take 20 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: During your next turn, this Pokemon can't attack.

name: Malamar V
Attack1Text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon with their Active Pokemon. This attack does 30 damage to the new Active Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Copperajah V
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokemon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Dubwool V
Ability1Text: This Pokemon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

name: Rillaboom VMAX
Attack2Text: You may discard up to 3 Grass Energy from this Pokemon. If you do, this attack does 50 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

name: Cinderace VMAX
Attack1Text: If this Pokemon was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does that much more damage.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Burned.

name: Inteleon VMAX
Attack1Text: You may put an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokemon into their hand.
Attack2Text: This attack also does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Toxtricity VMAX
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is Poisoned, this attack does 80 more damage.

name: Dragapult VMAX
Attack1Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Put 5 damage counters on your opponent's Benched Pokemon in any way you like.

name: Malamar VMAX
Attack1Text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Choose a card you find there and put it on the bottom of their deck.

name: Copperajah VMAX
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is a Basic Pokemon, this attack does 100 more damage.

name: Frosmoth
flavorText: It shows no mercy to any who desecrate fields and mountains. It will fly around on its icy wings, causing a blizzard to chase offenders away.
Ability1Text: As often as you like during your turn, you may attach a Water Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Water Pokemon.

name: Galarian Perrserker
flavorText: What appears to be an iron helmet is actually hardened hair. This Pokemon lives for the thrill of battle.
Ability1Text: Your Metal Pokemon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokemon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
